title: Management of the Mirani Swim Centre, Mirani Caravan Park and Mirani Community Hall
agency: Issued by Mackay Regional Council
description: Council is seeking a Contractor for the provision of services for undertaking ongoing management and promotion of the Mirani Swim Centre, Mirani Caravan Park, and Mirani Community Hall, ensuring that the best commercial and community outcomes are achieved on behalf of the Council. The services to be provided at the Venue must include all activities necessary to deliver a program that caters to as broad a cross-section of the community as possible. In keeping with good industry practice for similar facilities, the Contractor will provide associated support, operating activities, and services. The Contractor must provide a safe, efficient, hygienic, enjoyable family-friendly environment for the community.

title: Intersection Upgrades - Cooney Road, Nambour
agency: Issued by Sunshine Coast Council
description: Tenders are invited for the construction of a new signalised upgrade of the road intersection at Cooney Road and Bli Bli Road, Nambour. The Contractor must have and maintain for the life of the Contract, Department of Transport & Main Roads (DTMR) pre-qualification as stated below. Contractor Prequalification Status will be assessed in accordance with the DTMR published prequalification list, Contractor Prequalification Status, Transport and Main Roads, June 2023. Financial – F5 Roadworks – R3 Asphalt – A2 The scope of works includes, but is not limited to: Supply and installation of new traffic signals; Civil works including minor road shoulder widening and drainage; Reconstruction of private access driveways, road resurfacing and line marking;  Traffic and Community Management;  Modification, protection and liaison with Public Utility Plant (PUP) Infrastructure; All applications and approvals (excluding TMR Energex, Unitywater and Telstra) required by governing bodies and utility providers; Full Quality Assurance (QA) compliance – undertake all soil & concrete testing, provide test reports and QA documentation in accordance with DTMR specifications and standard drawings; Lighting installation, in accordance with Energex and DTMR Standards.

title: Delivery of the Study Sunshine Coast Industry Cluster Initiative
agency: Issued by Sunshine Coast Council
description: The Contract is to deliver the Study Sunshine Coast initiative within the Sunshine Coast Local Government Area, and requires the delivery of industry development and engagement programs within the areas of international education, talent development, marketing, and youth innovation.

title: CN00318B - Flood Reconstruction - Package 8B - Landslide Remedial Works
agency: Issued by Noosa Shire Council
description: Noosa Shire Council invites tenders from suitably qualified and experienced respondents for reconstruction works on the landslides located on Cooroy Belli Creek Road nearby property #179 and Musa Vale Road, Cooroy nearby property #139 as described in more detail in Part 4 – Scope. All works under contract must be compliant with all relevant Council Policies (https://www.noosa.qld.gov.au/aboutcouncil/governance/policies) and in particular Council’s Work Health and Safety Policy. The anticipated contract award is 10 October 2023 with Practical Completion on or before 6 April 2024.  For detailed information, response documentation and submission instructions, please access Noosa Shire Council's Current Tenders website.

agency: Issued by Noosa Shire Council
description: Noosa Shire Council invites Tenders from suitably qualified and experienced respondents for the supply, delivery and commissioning of generator sets as described in more detail in Part 4 – Scope. title: Kilcoy State School - New Amenities Block (Eligibility: PQC Level 2 Contractors)
agency: Issued by Department Of Education, Training and Employment
region: Building construction and support and maintenance and repair services - (50%)
description: The Department of Education (DoE) is calling for submissions for the design and construction of a new amenities block at Kilcoy State School, located at 47 Royston St, Kilcoy QLD 4515 as part of the Amenities Renewal program. The works include the demolition of the existing two amenities blocks and construction fo the new amenities block, covered link and associated landscaping works. The position of the building is at the rear of the school with adeqaute site access and working space. All works are to be completed by February 2024. Tender submissions will be accepted from contractors with a minium PQC Level 2 with certified 3rd Party Quality Assurance and a QBCC Builder's Licence to undertake the entire scope of works. Please contact Wesley Wittstock – Project Manager on wesley@honeywill.com.au with your PQC Certificate and company registration details. Tender Documentation will be emailed to eligiable contractors who meet the minimum PQC requirements.    Details of the site inspection will be advised in the email and letters to tenderers. Submissions close on Tuesday, 05 September 2023 at 3:00pm     IMPORTANT: Where a PQC Level is stated, the Principal is not obliged to provide a tender document, consider or accept a tender unless the tenderer: is pre-qualified under the Queensland Government’s Prequalification (PQC) System to the nominated level (or higher); satisfies financial requirements; and meets project-specific criteria. Information regarding the Pre-Qualified Contractor (PQC) rating system can be found on the Department of Public Works website: http://www.hpw.qld.gov.au/construction/PrequalificationBuildingSuppliers/BuildingConsultants/Pages/PQCSystemOverview.aspx

title: QuickStarts Queensland Statewide New Construction Program FY2023-24 & FY2024-25
agency: Issued by Department of Energy and Public Works - QBuild
description: The Department of Energy and Public Works, through QBuild is seeking to gain a better understanding of the current housing construction market, including multi-unit apartment, townhouse, duplexes, etc,  through an Expression of Interest (EOI) process.  The aim of this EOI is to shortlist potential suppliers through identifing the industry’s current capability and capacity to deliver the FY2023-24 & FY2024-25 QuickStarts Program projects and support the Queensland Government in achieving its object of housing Queenslanders. For detailed information on the specific goods / services sought under this tender, please review the "Specification Documents" in "Section 3 - Here is the detail".

title: Alexandra Hills SHS - Amenities Refurbishment
agency: Issued by Department Of Education, Training and Employment
region: Building construction and support and maintenance and repair services - (50%)
description: The Department of Education (DoE) is calling for tender submissions for the design and construction of an Amenities Refurbishment project at  Alexandra Hills SHS  , located at 3-27 Windemere Rd, Alexandra Hills QLD 4161, as part of the School Infrastructure Enhancement (SIE) program. The works consist of the reconfiguration and upgrade of student and staff amenities in two locations on the school site. The works are proposed to be staged with the main amenities building refurbishment commencing in the September holiday period and continuing into term 4 and the smaller English block amenities commencing in the December break and being completed early in term 1 of 2024. All works are to be completed by February 2024. Tender submissions will be accepted from contractors that meet the following requirements: Appropriate QBCC Builders licences to undertake the entire scope of works Professional Indemnity Insurance to the value of $1 Million.   QBCC Licensing and Professional Indemnity Insurance It is anticipated that a minimum of a QBCC (Low Rise) builders’ licence will be required for this project. Contractors are required to hold Professional Indemnity Insurance in accordance with the contract. Please contact Peter Millatt – Project Manager on peter@honeywill.com.au with your company details and tender documentation will be emailed to contractors.  Details of the site inspection will be advised in the email and letters to tenderers. Submissions close on 5/09/2023 at 3:00pm Site visit details : Details of the site inspection will be advised in the email and letters to tenderers

title: Business logic decision automation and calculation tool
agency: Issued by Department of Employment, Small Business and Training
description: The Department of Youth Justice, Employment, Small Business and Training (DYJESBT) is currently seeking information about potential business solutions in order to gather market intelligence. This RFI is part of  the DYJESBT Vocational Education and Training (VET) Modernisation and Transformation Program to deliver a consolidated, integrated and easy to use Microsoft based technology stack for capability provided by existing VET applications and solutions. This RFI comprises of the following components: Section 1 – Information about the RFI Section 2 – Requirements Section 3 – Response Schedule Section 4 – Conditions of Submission Section 5 – Appendices

title: Bundaberg State High School - Outdoor Learning Centre
agency: Issued by Department Of Education, Training and Employment
region: Building construction and support and maintenance and repair services - (50%)
description: The Department of Education (DoE) is inviting tenders for the design and construction of an Outdoor Learning Centre located at Bundaberg State High School, 37a Maryborough St, Bundaberg, QLD. Additional tender documentation is available for collection from Bundaberg State High School, 37a Maryborough St, Bundaberg, QLD, 4670 from Friday 11th of August 2023 or by contacting Nicole Halford, Facilities Manager on telephone 41545333 or email nhalf0@eq.edu.au for further information. Hard copy or electronic tenders are to be submitted by Friday 1st of September, 2023  at 2.00 pm  Wednesday 06 September 2023 at 2:00pm to Bundaberg State High School, PO Box 1041, Bundaberg, Q, 4670 or emailed to nhalf0@eq.edu.au. The project invites tenders for the construction on an Outdoor Learning Centre comprising a steel, gable roof structure with a new concrete floor, covering the equivalent of 2 basketball courts (lengthwise or end on end) and measuring 70 metres by 20 metres with a minimum roof height of 6 metres to the gutter.   The 2-court venue will be positioned on the existing site where the courts of the former PCYC were situated. This site is on the western side of the building we now call W Block (our Performing Arts building), identified as Site 83 on the Facilities Map and is adjacent to the train line. The following are to be included as part of the tender;   Construction of 2 concrete sport courts with a gable roof structure covering both courts with a minimum roof height of 6 metres to the gutter (gable ends enclosed to the bottom of the gable), with sheeting extending down each side 1.2 metres with the western side 2.4 metres – The concrete must be able to withstand large delivery trucks driving over it so it should be a minimum thickness of 150mm. Existing concrete on the western side of the adjacent building will be required to be cut approximately 3 metres from the building (concrete will need to be removed and dumped). New concrete is to match height of remaining concrete with appropriate fall to prevent water ponding on the surface. All existing bitumen court surfaces are to be removed along with existing posts and sleeves. Provision must be made to coordinate with the line marking contractor to install sport post sleeves (provided by school) in the concrete surface for netball and volleyball ( a line marking contractor will be coordinated by the school) Removal of the existing awning from the western side of W Block – to remain on site and be retained by the school for future use ( allowance should be made for necessary demolition). Any consequential repairs needed to the existing W Block roof should be included. Coordinate with the electrical contractor to allow for the provision of conduit to facilitate 3 phase power supply (electrical contractor to be arranged by the school) Allowance for engineering and beams to accommodate 4 Grand Slam ceiling mounted basketball systems, model number BB1004 – data sheet attached ( to be purchased by the school and installed at a later date) All necessary plumbing and stormwater drainage Appropriate engineering and certification No structural posts are to be positioned inside the structure All works are to be made safe to meet requirements of a school environment (ie no sharp edges on columns) Compliance with all relevant Department of Education requirements is a mandatory condition including; workplace health and safety, worksafe management plan and work method statements Site Visit Details : 10:00am on Thursday 24th of August 2023 Additional Details :  Architectural project design sketch, Site map, Site photos & Data sheet for Grand Slam basketball backboard system   Addendum 1: Suppliers to acknowledge addendum 1 as part of their offer

title: Cadastre and Address Modernisation (CAM) project  -  Location Addressing Implementation Partner
agency: Issued by Resources
description: The Department of Resources (Resources) is responsible for maintaining Queensland Government’s foundation spatial data, described by the ANZLIC Foundation Spatial Data Framework (FSDF).   Resources is currently modernising the systems used to manage and maintain our spatial cadastre (under the Land Parcel and Property theme) and location addressing (under the Geocoded Addressing theme) data.  Following proof-of-concept work to explore modernisation options, Resources commissioned the development of a Solution Architecture to describe the optimal “Future State” for our spatial cadastre and location addressing management and maintenance systems.  This Request for Quote (RfQ) seeks a provider of technical system design and implementation services to support the location addressing component(s) of the Future State Solution Architecture.  Existing Environment (Current State)  Two custom systems are currently used to manage and maintain Queensland’s location address data in an Ingres (11.2) RDBMS:  PropLoc, built in .NET, is used to insert bulk location addressing data supplied in pipe delimited text format.  Nucleus, built in .NET, is used for case-by-case queries and updates of location addressing data.  Proposed Solution (Future State)  The Future State Solution Architecture provides a database model for the management and maintenance of location addressing data, and related data such as property geometries, in a new environment.   The architecture describes a highly modern, standardised semantic web-based approach to data management and maintenance, supported by an enterprise spatial system.   The solution has been designed to provide greater flexibility, scalability, and standardization to support existing and emergent requirements for the effective and efficient management and maintenance of addressing data, while enabling connectivity and interoperability with a broader set of foundation spatial data.  Briefly, the architecture describes the following fundamental system components:  Storage of location address and associated data (such as road and geographical name information) in a cloud- and RDF-based, SPARQL protocol-compliant database solution, utilising the SHACL W3C standard for RDF validation.  Spatial features (such as address geometries) associated with location addresses to be managed in an Esri ArcGIS (currently Pro 3.1.2, Enterprise 10.9.1) environment, ensuring location address queries and updates through the ArcGIS environment and UI are reflected in the database.  A Create/Read/Update/Delete (CRUD) UI for management of location address data in a UI that does not necessarily require the visualisation of spatial components, allowing for more efficient bulk updates, simple fixes, etc.  A Message-Oriented Middleware (MOM) engine for asynchronous communication of data events between systems and stores, and to enable establish of robust publish/subscribe data interactions.    The Future State Solution Architecture aligns with the recommendations of the ICSM and ANZLIC Addressing 2035 strategy, and with national and international standards.  Requirements and Scope  Ingres, PropLoc and Nucleus are to be retired, as they are no longer fit-for-purpose.   Semantic data models, an associated supermodel, and supporting vocabularies have already been established as part of the Solution Architecture design. Resources has an established Esri ArcGIS Enterprise solution deployed in an Esri-managed AWS cloud environment. Development of data models, establishment of Esri ArcGIS, and establishment of cloud architecture are not in the scope of work.  Decisions on the optimal environment, compatible with the recommendations of the Future State Solution Architecture, including the following features, have not been identified or designed:  The database supporting the environment.  The CRUD UI.  Synchronisation methodology.  The MOM engine.  The scope of this project is the design and implementation of a location addressing management and maintenance environment based on the Future State Solution Architecture, with the following characteristics and deliverables:  Identify appropriate, supportable, sustainable, cost-efficient, and effective Future State implementation options though an assessment of existing Resources environments and architectures.  Should no existing environments and architectures meet the Future State requirements, recommended options and, in agreement with Resources:  Design and implement the agreed solution.  Develop an action plan/roadmap for migration from the Current State location address data environment to the agreed Future State location address data environment. For further details please see the contract details - ICT Products and Services.

agency: Issued by Metro South Hospital and Health Service
description: The Metro South Hospital and Health Service is seeking Proposals for Redland Hospital Central Sterile Supply Department (CSSD) Upgrade.  ​For detailed information on the specific goods / services sought under this tender, please review the "Specification Documents" in "Section 3 - Here is the detail".

title: Key Website Specialist to provide technical advice and support for ongoing maintenance and improvement of the FutureBeef website and associated Wordpress content management system.
agency: Issued by Department of Agriculture and Fisheries
description: Scope To assist with the delivery of the FutureBeef Project 2023-2027, the Customer is seeking a Specialist Supplier to provide technical advice and support for the ongoing maintenance and improvement of the ‘FutureBeef website’ and associated Wordpress content management system. Requirements These website services are required to ensure the project objectives and targets are met and FutureBeef has an up-to-date website where Northern Australia beef producers can source practical and relevant information.  These services support the Customer’s priority and strategy of “driving innovation and productivity through research, development and extension” by improving the uptake of innovative technologies and practices.  Specifics To provide technical advice and support for the ongoing maintenance and improvement of the FutureBeef website and associated Wordpress content management system (CMS) up until 1 September 2027.  Services to be provided include (but not limited to): •     Provision of advice to website managers in the use and operation of the Wordpress CMS. •     Assistance with any issues that arise with the website use and operation. •     Testing site speed and make recommendations for improvements •     Technical search engine optimisation •     Run screaming frog or similar program on a monthly basis to identify broken links and supply this list of broken links to the FutureBeef team for correction. •     Uninstall MailChimp and install Vision6 as the new e-newsletter program linked to the website For detailed information on the specific goods / services sought under this tender, please review the "Contract Services" in "Schedule 1 of the Contract Details".

title: CP010 - Provision of General Plumbing Gas Fitting & Drainage Services Within FCRC
agency: Issued by Fraser Coast Regional Council
description: Fraser Coast Regional Council is inviting offers from suitably qualified and experienced Tenderers for CP010 - Provision of General Plumbing, Gas Fitting & Drainage Services Within FCRC. This invitation to offer is for a panel of contractors to service council’s requirements within the Fraser Coast LGA, it will be split into five geographical areas, that being Hervey Bay, Maryborough, Tiaro, Maryborough West & K’Gari. Council is looking for two to three contractors in each boundary or less depending on the capacity/capability of contractors. The panel will operate on either set rates, calling of quotes or in some cases both. The proposed contract is for two years with two by one-year extensions and there is no guarantee of business. The expectation on the contractors will be when requested to quote or they are engaged to carry out the works, they will respond promptly and complete the works on time and to council’s satisfaction. Tenderers can tender for any boundary, multiple boundaries, or all boundaries.   Please be advised that tender response forms are to be submitted as two files only and in the following format: - Non Price Response Form: PDF including all supporting documentation as one file. This PDF must not contain any price related criteria. - Price Response Form: Excel Failure to comply with this requirement may result in a non-conforming offer.

title: Mediation and Conciliation Services Panel
agency: Issued by Queensland Building and Construction Commission
description: The Queensland Building and Construction Commission has issued this ITO with the objectives of: To join a panel of professional mediators and conciliators to deliver conciliation services between homeowners and contractors to secure outcomes ratified in an agreement with all documentation to be returned to the QBCC on completion and within timeframes. The expectation of QBCC is that, providers from the conciliators panel will be offered a case to provide their services to. Providers will be able to accept/decline the offer, offers that are declined will need to provide a reasonable rationale for declining the offer.  On accepting the offer, the conciliator will contact, organise and deliver a conciliation service to work through the issues. On completion of a service, the conciliator will formalise the outcome in an Agreement of which a copy will be provided to the QBCC.  Any outstanding issues will be progressed by QBCC through other legislative pathways for resolution. A briefing session will be held online at 9am 30th August 2023 to respond to any questions and gain further clarity on customer requirements and expectations. If you are interested in attending the briefing session, please email mcadmin@qbcc.qld.gov.au by 5:00 pm on 28th August 2023 referring QBCC2024106. For detailed information on the specific goods / services sought under this tender, please review the "SOA Invitation to Offer Documents" in "Section 3 - Here is the detail".

title: Shallow Gas Migration Quantification for Wellbores and Nearby Earth Surface at UCG Sites
agency: Issued by Resources
description: GEO2024_00677 Shallow Gas Migration Quantification for Wellbores and Nearby Earth Surface at UCG Sites The State of Queensland through Technical Services, a business unit of the Department of Resources (the Customer) invites you to submit an offer for the contract GEO2024_00677 in accordance with the attached conditions of offer and conditions of contract. The Offeror shall keep its Offer valid for 60 days Enclosed are the RFQ documents, which include the following: Request for Quote Appendix - B (This document contains x21 separate folders that have been attached separately due to uploading restrictions) Contract Details Scope & Requirements Specifications Schedule 1 & 2 Queensland Government Supplier Code of Conduct Supplier Declaration of Code of Conduct To submit an offer, complete the documents listed below and submit by the date and time stated on the invitation to offer: Request for Quote Any information the Tenderer would like to supply in support of the tender For any enquiries regarding this invitation, please contact Alex Anderson by email amlp.accounts@resources.qld.gov.au or on mobile: 0435 403 806   Yours faithfully                                                                Alex Anderson Project Officer (Procurement and Contracts) On behalf of the Customer

title: Provision of Kinross Road New Pump Station Construction
agency: Issued by Redland City Council
description: Redland City Council is seeking Expressions of Interest from suitable qualified and experienced contractors capable of delivering the design and construction of a New Sewer PS required at its Cleveland Wastewater Treatment Plant. The objective of this Expression of Interest is to identify experienced contractors in undertake the Stage 1 works with a view of shortlisting contractors to proceed to the tender stage.   Please refer to the EOI package for further information including details of the mandatory information session.

title: Kin Kora State School - Outside School Hours Care - OSHC
agency: Issued by Department Of Education, Training and Employment
description: Information about the opportunity This Invitation to Offer (ITO) will allow Suppliers to offer for OSHC services detailed in this ITA. Offers are invited under the Pre-qualified Panel QED116585 to respond to ITA QED119751 This Invitation comprises the following documents. Documents Instructions to Provider Part 1 Invitation to Apply For information – read only Part 2 Facility Agreement/ Part B Provider to complete and return Part 3 Response Schedules Provider to complete and return Indicative timetable (subject to change) Site Visit at Date Friday 18 August 2023 Time 10:30 am  Offers must be lodged by 2:00 pm Australian Eastern Standard Time (Brisbane) on Date: 08/09/2023 Questions about this Tender Please direct all questions about this tender to procurement.oshc@qed.qld.gov.au

title: Chatswood Hills State School - Admin Refurbishment, Teaching Modular Conversion & Aged Modular Removal - 34-702328 (Admin) & 34-702329 (Modular Refurb)
agency: Issued by Department Of Education, Training and Employment
region: Building construction and support and maintenance and repair services - (50%)
description: The Department of Education (DoE) is inviting tenders for Principal Contractors to undertake the refurbishment works at Chatswood Hills State School – 21 Raleigh Street, Springwood QLD 4127. Tender documentation is available by contacting Ridgemill Pty Ltd, by contacting Gerard O’Keeffe on 0447 733 698 or email tenders@ridgemill.com.au. Submissions:  Electronic tenders are to be submitted by Friday 8th September 2023 at 2:00pm at tenders@ridgemill.com.au. (IMPORTANT: Where a PQC Level is stated, the Principal is not obliged to provide a tender document, consider or accept a tender unless the tenderer: is pre-qualified under the Queensland Government’s Prequalification (PQC) System to the nominated level (or higher); satisfies financial requirements; and meets project-specific criteria. Information regarding the Pre-Qualified Contractor (PQC) rating system can be found on the Department of Public Works website: http://www.hpw.qld.gov.au/construction/PrequalificationBuildingSuppliers/BuildingConsultants/Pages/PQCSystemOverview.aspx) Site Visit:  A site inspection has been arranged on Friday 18 August 2023 at 10:00am, at Chatswood Hills State School, 21 Raleigh Street, Springwood QLD 4127. Meet at school Administration Building. PQC:  Only PQC Level 2 eligible Building Contractors will be provided the tender documents . The refurbishment scope of works will generally involve the following construction activities; • Refurbishment of Administration Building • Conversion of existing Teaching Modular building into a Music GLA & Ensemble Space. • Demolition and removal of existing aged Music Modular Building. • Conversion of existing Tiered Seating Covered Area into an enclosed flexible area.

title: Keebra Park State High School -Administration Refurbishment
agency: Issued by Department Of Education, Training and Employment
region: Building construction and support and maintenance and repair services - (50%)
description: The Department of Education (DoE) is calling for tender submissions for the design and construction of the existing Administration Refurbishment and extension at  Keebra Park State High School, located at Anne Street, Southport, QLD, 4215, as part of a school direct funded programme. The scope comprises the internal refurbishment and extension of the existing Administration building including new flooring, partitions, electrical, joinery, glazing and external roofing. All works are to be completed by December 2023. Tender submissions will be accepted from contractors that meet the following requirements: Appropriate QBCC Builders licences to undertake the entire scope of works Professional Indemnity Insurance to the value of $1,000,000.00 Please contact Tayla Kearns – Project Manager on tayla@honeywill.com.au with your company details and tender documentation will be emailed to contractors. Details of the site inspection will be advised in the email and letters to tenderers. Submissions close on Wednesday the 6th of September 2023 at 3:00pm Site Visit Details: Details of the site inspection will be advised in the email and letters to tenderers

agency: Issued by Queensland Health Gold Coast Hospital and Health Service
description: Gold Coast Hospital and Health Service is seeking offers for a Principal Contractor to complete fit out works at Gold Coast University Hospital and Robina Hospital.

title: EQL Traffic Management Services
agency: Issued by Energy Queensland Limited
description: SR27368189​ - EQL Traffic Management Services The Tender pack, scope and response schedules are available from EQL's online tendering tool (SAP Ariba). The scope of services includes, the provision of competent and reliable Traffic Management Services throughout the Energy Queensland Limited (EQL) Distribution Area on a 24-hour, 7 days per week basis.   Sufficient resources are required to provide continuous shifts when required for Planned Works, Unplanned Works and Emergency Works. Traffic management services are utilised for the construction and maintenance of the EQL electricity network and delivery of power poles.  All Energy Queensland traffic management Contractors are required to be registered under the Traffic Management Registration Scheme with the Queensland Department of Transport and Main Roads (DTMR) and must maintain this registration throughout the term of the Standing Offer.   How to Participate Tenderers who wish to register and participate in this sourcing event should follow the below instructions: Tenderers will be required to register with SAP Ariba by sending an email to the nominated Contract Officer suzie.bramham@energyq.com.au. It is recommended that Tenderers who wish to participate in the tender start the registration early as the registration process can take some time. The email subject should contain the above tender title including the Doc number and the email should contain the following; Business entity name Business email address eg. Tenders@companyname.com  (Please note the Ariba system does not recognise @hotmail, @live or @outlook email domains so plan accordingly when supplying contact email addresses.) Postal address ABN Contact name Phone number When registration is complete and the Sourcing Event opens, Tenderers will be invited to respond and will be able to access the EQL SAP Ariba realm via a link contained in the email notification. Please note this link will expire within 24 hours. Tenderers must accept the prerequisite Bidder Agreement under the ‘Review and Accept Prerequisites’ tab in Ariba to ensure all system generated notifications are received. This includes, but is not limited to, Content updates and changes to Event Timing. Further information on participating in sourcing events is located at:  https://www.energyq.com.au/suppliers. If the Tenderer elects to submit a response, they must do so using SAP Ariba only. Submissions provided via email or QTenders will not be considered for evaluation.  Tenderers are encouraged to read all relevant SAP Ariba documentation located at https://www.energyq.com.au/suppliers All queries are to be directed to suzie.bramham@energyq.com.au
